column4: OH DEAR GOD! I just did a mv ~/Desktop ~/bin  I meant to move A file from the desktop I screwed up. now I don't HAVE a ~/Desktop directory. Help?
I did. And I must say, that was one of my worst "OMG U CAN DO ANYTHING" in Ubuntu moments. Scared me =D
I meant more, how do I grab command line arguments in a bash script?
So I don't seg fault, how do I check if command line args WERE passed?
$# is the number of arguments you received.
How can I check if $1 is defined?
If you pass 2 arguments to the script, $# is equal to 2.
And your script won't die if you reference $1 but weren't passed any arguments.  The variable will probably have the empty string or 0.
I'm used to C, where shit explodes if you don't code well ;)
Yeah, obviously it's never good to rely on it, in C or bash or anywhere else.
